definition: market access in return for technology transfer (PRC policy since the 1980s which gives foreign companies access to China's domestic market in exchange for sharing their intellectual property, characterized by the US in the 2019 trade war as "forced technology transfer")

the attitude of mechanically borrowing (ideas etc)

to catch up with England and surpass the USA (economic goal)
